channel.title: Comments on: Do You Get A Benefit From Compressing Backups If You Already Have Compressed Data?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: What are alternatives for compressing data in individual tables on the Standard edition of SQL Server?
item.content:encoded: What are alternatives for compressing data in individual tables on the Standard edition of SQL Server?

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Yes, data compression is Enterprise Edition only. I don't see a point of adding winzip since I backup straight to tape..backup is about a terabyte...last I looked Winzip couldn't handle more than 4GB but that might have been an older version of the tool or a 32 bit version
item.content:encoded: Yes, data compression is Enterprise Edition only. I don’t see a point of adding winzip since I backup straight to tape..backup is about a terabyte…last I looked Winzip couldn’t handle more than 4GB but that might have been an older version of the tool or a 32 bit version

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: In addition, if you add testing with WinZip, what results will you get?
item.content:encoded: In addition, if you add testing with WinZip, what results will you get?

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: Is data compression only Enterprise and Developer's editions option?
item.content:encoded: Is data compression only Enterprise and Developer’s editions option?

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Keith, I will test on a real DB where most of the data is compressed in a week or two. I did test backup compression on real databases but most of the data was not already compressed, you can find that here: Backup Compression Tests

Will let you know in a week or two

item.title: By: Keith Mescha
item.dc:creator: Keith Mescha
item.description: Nice article and good information. I have had similar results. Have you tested these scenarios on a real DB not made up data? Do you think there would be different results based on the design of the DB?
item.content:encoded: Nice article and good information. I have had similar results. Have you tested these scenarios on a real DB not made up data? Do you think there would be different results based on the design of the DB?
